issues.title: Missing Administrative Regulation for Implementation Procedures
issues.description: While the Board Policy establishes employee civil and legal rights, there is no corresponding Administrative Regulation to provide implementation procedures for whistleblower complaints, retaliation investigations, and protection processes. California law requires districts to have procedures for handling these matters.

legal_citations.text: Requires districts to establish procedures for handling whistleblower complaints and investigations of retaliation claims

issues.required_language: Administrative procedures detailing: complaint filing process, investigation procedures, timeline for responses, appeal processes, and interim protection measures for whistleblowers

issues.title: Missing Whistleblower Hotline Display Requirement Implementation
issues.description: The policy references the requirement to display whistleblower rights and hotline information but lacks implementation details about where, how, and who is responsible for maintaining these displays.

legal_citations.text: Requires prominent display in lettering larger than size 14 point type of employees' rights and responsibilities under whistleblower laws, including the telephone number of the whistleblower hotline

issues.required_language: Specific procedures for posting whistleblower information including: designated locations (employee break rooms, administrative offices, etc.), responsible staff for updates, frequency of review, and format requirements

issues.title: Missing Search Procedures for District Property
issues.description: The policy states that school officials may search district property under an employee's control when necessary for health, welfare, or safety, but provides no procedural safeguards or implementation guidelines.

legal_citations.text: Employee rights regarding searches must be balanced with district authority and require procedural protections

issues.required_language: Procedures for conducting searches including: authorization requirements, documentation, witness requirements, employee notification rights, and appeal processes

issues.title: Missing Reference to Complaint Procedures
issues.description: The policy references "district's complaint procedures" for whistleblower retaliation but doesn't specify which complaint procedure applies or cross-reference the appropriate policy.

legal_citations.text: Requires clear complaint procedures for employees alleging retaliation for whistleblower activities

issues.required_language: Specific reference to applicable complaint procedure policy number (typically BP/AR 4144 - Complaints) or establishment of specific whistleblower complaint procedures
